title: [EPIC] Phase 6: Automated AI Identity Verification
description:
**NEW EPIC - OPTIONAL ADD-ON.** Automate identity verification using third-party AI services. Replace manual staff review with automated checks.

**Timeline:** 6-8 weeks
**Team:** Core MVP team (Team A)
**Priority:** LOW (P3)
**Dependencies:** Phase 5 (enterprise features first for revenue)
**Cost:** ~$2-5 per verification (Onfido/Jumio)

**Strategic Context:** This is an OPTIONAL enhancement to Phase 2 (Manual Identity Verification). The core platform can generate revenue with manual verification. Add AI automation only if:
1. Manual review becomes a bottleneck (>500 verifications/day)
2. Customers request faster verification (<5 minutes)
3. Cost analysis shows ROI (staff time vs AI costs)

**Key Features:**

**1. Automated Document Verification:**
- OCR extraction (name, DOB, ID number, expiration date)
- Document authenticity checks (holograms, watermarks, security features)
- Cross-reference extracted data with enrollment data
- Auto-reject if mismatch detected

**2. Liveness Detection:**
- Active challenges (head movement, facial expressions) via third-party API
- Passive analysis (texture, depth, micro-expressions)
- Presentation attack detection (photos, videos, masks, deepfakes)
- Liveness score >90% required to pass

**3. Automated Face Matching:**
- Compare live selfie vs. ID photo using third-party API
- Configurable similarity threshold (default 85%)
- Decision logic:
  - Auto-approve if match >85%
  - Auto-reject if match <75%
  - Manual review if 75-84% (borderline cases)

**4. Update Verification Queue:**
- Staff only review:
  - Borderline cases (75-84% match)
  - Auto-rejects (for quality assurance)
  - Random sampling (5% for audit)
- Auto-approvals bypass queue entirely
- Add AI confidence scores to staff UI

**Database Changes:**
```prisma
model IdentityVerification {
  // Add AI fields to existing model from Phase 2
  ocrExtractedName     String?
  ocrExtractedDOB      DateTime?
  ocrConfidence        Float?               // 0-100

  livenessScore        Float?               // 0-100
  livenessProvider     String?              // onfido, jumio, persona

  faceMatchScore       Float?               // 0-100
  faceMatchThreshold   Float                @default(85.0)
  faceMatchPassed      Boolean              @default(false)

  automatedDecision    Boolean              @default(false)
  automatedAt          DateTime?
}
```

**Third-Party Service (Required):**
- Provider: Onfido OR Jumio OR Persona
- Cost: ~$2-5 per verification
- Must abstract with provider interface for vendor flexibility

**New Packages:**
- @proctorguard/identity-verification (provider abstraction layer)
  - Interface: IIdentityProvider
  - Implementations: OnfidoProvider, JumioProvider, PersonaProvider
  - Configuration: API keys, thresholds, retry logic

**Critical Files:**
- packages/identity-verification/providers/interface.ts - Provider interface (new)
- packages/identity-verification/providers/onfido.ts - Onfido implementation (new)
- packages/database/prisma/schema.prisma - Add AI fields to IdentityVerification
- apps/candidate/app/dashboard/exams/[id]/verify/page.tsx - Update capture flow with AI checks
- apps/staff/app/dashboard/verifications/page.tsx - Filter auto-approved from queue

**Success Metrics:**
- 80%+ verifications auto-approved (no manual review needed)
- False rejection rate <5% (validated against manual review sample)
- Average verification time <60 seconds (from submission to decision)
- Cost per verification <$3 (negotiate volume discounts)
- Manual review queue reduced by 80%

**Risks & Mitigation:**
- **Risk:** Vendor lock-in
  - **Mitigation:** Provider abstraction layer, annual vendor evaluation
- **Risk:** Cost scaling at high volume
  - **Mitigation:** Negotiate volume discounts, consider self-hosted ML if >10K/month
- **Risk:** AI bias (lower accuracy for certain demographics)
  - **Mitigation:** Test on diverse populations, monitor false rejection rates by demographic
- **Risk:** Regulation changes (BIPA, EU AI Act)
  - **Mitigation:** Legal review, configurable thresholds per jurisdiction
